title: Man Utd star Daniel James somehow plays on after sickening head clash during Wales match
text:
Wales winger Daniel James somehow played on after the sickening head clash (Picture: ESPN)

Daniel James looked like he was knocked old cold during Wales’ 1-1 draw Croatia – but the winger somehow got up and played on for the remainder of Euro 2020 qualifying match.

The 21-year-old has had an impressive start to his Manchester United career since completing a £15million move from Swansea this summer, scoring three goals in his opening ten appearances for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s Red Devils.

On Sunday evening, Ryan Giggs rewarded James with a spot on the left wing as Real Madrid’s Gareth Bale started wide right in Cardiff.

Nikola Vlasic put Croatia in front after only nine minutes and it appeared Wales’ night was about to get even worse as Domagoj Vida clattered into James’ head from behind.

Looks awful watching it again! Daniel James was knocked out big time. pic.twitter.com/ZS6cHsedWN — Adam Humphreys (@AdamAce1066) October 13, 2019

James was sprawled out motionless on the turf as Wales’ medical staff rushed to his aid in worrying scenes at the Cardiff City Stadium.

The Group E clash paused for several minutes as James’ received treatment on the floor before the United forward somehow returned to his feet and carried on playing.

Croatia looked to be heading into half-time with the lead but Bale, Wales’ hero on so many occasions down the years, had other ideas.

The Madrid forward slotted past Dominik Livakovic in first-half injury time to level for Wales and Giggs’ men held on after the break to share the points with the World Cup runners-up.

The match was put on hold for several minutes as James received treatment (Picture: Getty)

James passed the concussion protocol following his collision with Vida and insisted that he had not been knocked out.

Asked how he felt after the clash, James told Sky Sports: ‘Yeah, fine.

‘I think he just caught me in the head but I didn’t get knocked out fortunately.’

Daniel James was just knocked out unconscious! Yet 3 minutes later he has been allowed back onto the pitch 🤷‍♂️ — Ryan Mason (@RyanMason) October 13, 2019

Ryan Mason, who was forced to retire after a sickening head collision, was furious with the decision to allow James to carry on in Cardiff.

‘Daniel James was just knocked out unconscious!’ the former Tottenham midfielder tweeted.

‘Yet 3 minutes later he has been allowed back onto the pitch.’
